front.title: Monotone sequences theorem
front.concept: What says the monotone sequences theorem?

back.explanation: IF a sequence is bounded AND monotone THEN converges (has a limit).
A sequence is bounded when it is bounded from above and from below.

front.title: Standard form
front.concept: What is the standard form of an argument?

back.explanation: It is a way of display an argument. On the top you write the premises, then draw an horizontal line and below it draw a triangle of three dots (symbol for 'therefore') and to its right write the conclusion.
